content: page 1 light as a feather cowl designed by katie herrod of songbird handmade the light as a feather cowl design is a collaboration with campfiber yarns to explore their gorgeous new yak silk dk yarn the result is a soft stretchy lightweight easy-to-wear cowl full of beautiful texture this tube cowl is knit in one solid colour from bottom to top featuring ribbing on both ends and deliciously squishy waffle texture in the middle look for my other patterns in the light as a feather family light as a feather cowl katie herrod 2025 v 1 page 2 size 22 circumference x 10 tall yarn approximately 215 yards/195 meters of dk weight yarn recommended in a solid or tonal colour to show the texture sample shown in campfiber yarns yak silk dk in night flight 231 yards/211 meters/100 grams suggested needles us 6/4 0 mm or size required to obtain gauge 16 /40 cm circular needle dpns or long circular needles for the magic loop method notions stitch marker measuring tape scissors tapestry needle gauge 21 sts and 35 row per 4 /10 cm measured over waffle stitch knit in the round after blocking notes i used a long tail cast-on https //youtu be/sn9cneozolc si=mbxdb4qslgwu8ewy and bind-off in pattern https //blog tincanknits com/2022/08/25/binding-off-in-pattern/ adjusted to work for 2x1 ribbing but you are welcome to use your preferred stretchy cast on and bind off cowl width can be adjusted in increments of 3 stitches cowl length is also adjustable find a tip for using up most of a full skein on page 3 this cowl will benefit from blocking to even out the stitches let the yarn relax and bloom to its full potential and to improve the finished appearance to block soak finished cowl in cool water for 15 minutes then squeeze out excess water do not wring or twist roll it up in a clean dry towel and step on it to remove as much moisture as you can then lay the cowl on a dry flat surface and shape it according to finished dimensions and let it air-dry completely it s now ready to wear light as a feather cowl katie herrod 2025 v 1 page 3 abbreviations bor beginning of round co cast on dpns double-pointed needles k knit a stitch k2 = knit two stitches p purl a stitch p2 = purl two stitches st/sts stitch/stitches tip to use up as much of a full skein of yarn as possible without running out either a weigh the yarn before you begin and then weigh it again after the cast on and ribbing to calculate how much yarn the cast on and ribbing used knit the body until there is just over the amount used for the cast on and ribbing remaining then work the ribbing and bind off for example if the yarn weighed 100 grams before you began and your cast on and ribbing used 18 grams knit the body until you have around
